contextId.information: Here "feet" represents Christ's lordship, authority, and power. AT: "all things under Christ's power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The apostles also used "world" to refer to the selfish behaviors and corrupt values of the people living in this world. AT: "according to the values of people living in the world" or "following the principles of this present world" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: according to the age of this world

contextId.information: The words "flesh" and "mind" represent the entire person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: We were acting according to the evil desires of our flesh. We were doing the will of the flesh and of the mind

contextId.information: "By the death of his body on the cross" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
That is, by means of Christ's death on the cross. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: through the cross ... With the cross

contextId.information: Here "your glory" is a metonym for the pride they should feel or will feel in the future kingdom. The Christians in Ephesus should be proud of what Paul is suffering in prison. AT: "This is for your benefit" or "You should be proud of this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "heart" represents a person's inner being, and "through" expresses the means by which Christ lives within the believer. Christ lives in the hearts of believers because God graciously allows them to have faith. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
They refuse to listen to God and follow his teachings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: because of the hardness of their hearts

contextId.information: The word "days" is a metonym for what people do during those days. AT: "because the people around you are doing all kinds of evil things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"I am now in prison because I am a representative of the gospel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: It is for the gospel that I am an ambassador in chains
